NewsDetail.Name: 2011 Faculty Banquet Article
NewsDetail.Title: 2011 Faculty Banquet
NewsDetail.BodyCopy:
On May 19th sixteen faculty members and six adjunct faculty were recognized and presented with the Exemplary Faculty Award. This annual event celebrates the teaching efforts of faculty at BYU-Idaho. The evening included faculty comments and best practices compiled in a video that highlighted faculty efforts on our campus. The video further outlined the categories of scholarship of learning & teaching, campus citizenship, professional development, and campus outreach that were used by the best practices committee in soliciting recommendations for the awards.

Awards were presented to Jo Anne Kay, Terry Call, Kathy Jo Cook, Gary Shenton, Scott Franson, Wendy Bone, Nolan Parson, Tim Tanner, Drew Eagar, Lee Barney, Delaina Scholes, Justin Miller, James Helfrich, Danae Romrell, Ron Kinville, Steve Hunsaker, Vaun Waddell, Phil Murdock, Christy Owens, Daniel Dewey, Larry Shaw, and Mike Sweet.

Fenton Broadhead and Kelly Burgener honored recipients of the Thomas E Ricks Grants and recent retirees in their comments. They explained this event was a time to learn best practices from one another. After a musical number by Stanford Olsen, President Kim B. Clark shared some closing remarks about the future of BYU-Idaho, the consecration of the faculty, and increasing resources for faculty development.

Over four hundred and fifty faculty and spouses attend this event which celebrated excellence in teaching and learning at BYU-Idaho. The evening was sponsored by the Best Practices Committee chaired by Shane Goodwin who noted "We hope the all-faculty banquet will continue to be a solid tradition as we recognize some of the many outstanding teachers we have throughout our campus."

President Clark's remarks
